intro: Spermacoce meyeniana, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and southern Africa, where it thrives in woodland and grassland habitats. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Spermacoce meyeniana is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance.
